SessionStart.description: Initialize Laravel context on session start

hooks.prompt: DANGEROUS: This command will DELETE ALL DATA. Before proceeding: 1) Is this a development environment? 2) Is this intentional? 3) Is there a backup? If production or uncertain, STOP and ask the user first.
WARNING: --force flag detected. This bypasses production safeguards. Confirm: 1) Is this intentional? 2) Is the environment correct? Only proceed if explicitly requested by user.
DANGEROUS: Destructive operation in tinker detected. This will permanently delete data. Confirm with user before proceeding.
A PHP file was written. Briefly check for Laravel best practices: 1) N+1 query patterns? 2) Mass assignment vulnerability? 3) Missing input validation? Only mention if critical issues found.

PostToolUse.description: Check Laravel best practices after PHP file write

hooks.prompt: A Model file was written. Check: 1) Is $fillable defined? 2) Are relationships typed? 3) Are $casts defined? Only flag critical issues.
A Controller was written. Check: 1) Using Form Requests? 2) Methods under 30 lines? 3) Authorization handled? Only flag critical issues.
A Migration was written. Check: 1) Foreign keys indexed? 2) Has down() method? 3) Nullable columns marked? Only flag issues.

PostToolUse.matcher: tool == "Bash" && tool_input.command matches "php artisan test" && tool_output matches "FAIL"

hooks.prompt: Tests failed. Before proceeding, use the laravel-systematic-debugging skill to investigate the root cause. Do not attempt random fixes.
